post_text: PTs- thoughts on becoming an APTA member? I've heard mixed thoughts and wondering if it worth it. If so, what other dues (chapters) did feel was worth paying for in addition to membership and your state chapter?

comments.text: I love being a member. I'm headed to Boston on Wednesday for Combined Section Meeting, a gathering of over 15,000 PTs/PTAs students. The educational content, resources, CEUs is top notch and being a member and getting involved in the Academy of APTA Home Health has introduced me to tons of clinicians across the country, given me opportunities to represent home/mobile based clinicians on CPG projects, present content on part B at home to the Neuro section. I could go on and on. It is a seriously small percentage of our profession that belong to the APTA compared to other health care professions. I encourage everyone to get involved and be the difference you want to see.

No way. My job paid all membership dues so I became a member and part of several sections and stayed a member for 6 years and got nothing out of it more than a magazine and the occasional sticker. Not worth it.

full_thread_text:
POST: PTs- thoughts on becoming an APTA member? I've heard mixed thoughts and wondering if it worth it. If so, what other dues (chapters) did feel was worth paying for in addition to membership and your state chapter?

COMMENT 1: I love being a member. I'm headed to Boston on Wednesday for Combined Section Meeting, a gathering of over 15,000 PTs/PTAs students. The educational content, resources, CEUs is top notch and being a member and getting involved in the Academy of APTA Home Health has introduced me to tons of clinicians across the country, given me opportunities to represent home/mobile based clinicians on CPG projects, present content on part B at home to the Neuro section. I could go on and on. It is a seriously small percentage of our profession that belong to the APTA compared to other health care professions. I encourage everyone to get involved and be the difference you want to see.

COMMENT 2: No way. My job paid all membership dues so I became a member and part of several sections and stayed a member for 6 years and got nothing out of it more than a magazine and the occasional sticker. Not worth it.

" Copy of an organizational structure diagram/flowchart"

comments.text:

A flowchart is an org chart consistent with documentation provided/updated in Section 5.

post_text:
## Plans succeed with many advisors...

**Looking to have your plans succeed in 2024? **

**It would be wise to get around many advisors.**

Many advisory groups have been started by the APTA and other organizations, but to be honest, they seem to miss the mark of what a practice owner actually needs.

That is why we created Success Council's - A council of 6-8 practice owners across the country that are in similar revenue range and size to grow in connection and trust with. We say #ironsharpensiron, but the question is - Are you putting yourself around iron?

When you start to run a business, you start to quickly realize that the game that you are playing is vastly different than most people around you, and most of the time...family and friends simply can't relate.

This can be frustrating and isolating. We have created the community where you can grow your own personal board of directors as you grow your company. Other entrepreneurs that you can rely upon for counsel, accountability, collaboration, and support.

If you are interested, comment "Success Council" below! And then, we will get you all of the details.

comments.text: Not only is this Community, it‚Äôs FAMILY üôåüôåüíØüíØ
Let‚Äôs go!

That is why we created Success Council's - A council of 6-8 practice owners across the country that are in similar revenue range and size to grow in connection and trust with. We say #ironsharpensiron, but the question is - Are you putting yourself around iron?

When you start to run a business, you start to quickly realize that the game that you are playing is vastly different than most people around you, and most of the time...family and friends simply can't relate.

This can be frustrating and isolating. We have created the community where you can grow your own personal board of directors as you grow your company. Other entrepreneurs that you can rely upon for counsel, accountability, collaboration, and support.

If you are interested, comment "Success Council" below! And then, we will get you all of the details.

COMMENT 2: Let‚Äôs go!

post_text:
Hello!

I'd love your input. I launched my practice five months ago, but I'm struggling to gain traction. I've partnered with a marketer who holds an extensive lead list in my local area, boasting 2,000-3,000 potential leads. He sends out emails for me 1-2 times a week, featuring a short video that I create. We meet weekly to brainstorm video ideas, and he's also working on getting me into gyms for workshops. His fee is $750/month and he covers all the operational costs. I'm planning to collaborate for three months to assess the return on investment. Do you believe his services justify the cost? As someone new to marketing, I'd greatly appreciate your feedback. 

Thank you so much for your input

comments.text: What type of cash practice.. what population?

Are you out in the community and networking? Have you met with your local direct care physicians? Reached out to nurse case managers, ones in private practice and within in hospital systems? Visited your local senior centers and give talks about your services, disease process, fall prevention ect.. whatever your target population go to where they are and be visible. I'm scheduled to talk to a local Parkinsons support group and a dementia caregivers group in January- emailed them myself, introducing myself and asking to speak on the topic. You have to put yourself out there!

post_text: Looking to start treating people in groups for exercise/ strength/ balance and endurance training. How would I bill this ? How many clients can be in group?

comments.text:
Would definitely approach this from a wellness side rather than PT.

If they're all in PT for the same things and you want to do group therapy to save time, fine, but the reimbursement is not good. 

If they're all just needing generic/community-accessible physical activity, then do that as a group exercise class instead.
Medicare reimburses terribly for group therapy if it‚Äôs therapeutic. If it‚Äôs wellness then it would be cash pay. I have integrated this into my practice. Let me know if you have any questions

full_thread_text:
POST: Looking to start treating people in groups for exercise/ strength/ balance and endurance training. How would I bill this ? How many clients can be in group?

COMMENT 1: Would definitely approach this from a wellness side rather than PT.

If they're all in PT for the same things and you want to do group therapy to save time, fine, but the reimbursement is not good. 

If they're all just needing generic/community-accessible physical activity, then do that as a group exercise class instead.

COMMENT 2: Medicare reimburses terribly for group therapy if it‚Äôs therapeutic. If it‚Äôs wellness then it would be cash pay. I have integrated this into my practice. Let me know if you have any questions

post_text:
Any tips, tricks or words of encouragement for a new business owner. I'm about 2-3 months into my PT business and i've gotten a handful of patient leads but nothing that's translated into patients. 
Thanks!
Tulsi

comments.text: I‚Äôm new as well and from  what I hear is that we need patience.  (And patients!)

Keep going! I‚Äôm into my 4th month and finally getting traction. Connect with local gyms (Pilates, yoga, where moms usually hang out since you‚Äôre pelvic floor), networking groups, set up tabling, etc. use your time wisely and give yourself grace. What you put in is what you‚Äôre going to get. Educate yourself in sales so you know what to say when you do have a prospect/lead in front of you. Best of luck!

post_text:
***I NEED YOUR HELP!!!! ***üôåüôè

Two of the members of the Uncaged Clinician Facebook Group have been selected as finalists for the South By Southwest Education Conference in Austin, TX in March of 2024!

Your Fearless Leader..."The Captain"...@David Bayliff and "The Professor of Profit" Dr F Scott Feill have proposed a Podcast Style Live Presentation entitled: ***Why Zone of Genius is Imperative Towards Establishing Expertise***

Starting TODAY, **Wednesday, August 16**, the greater online community is invited to vote and share their input on all of the session ideas through **Sunday, August 20**. 

The community's input will amount to 30% of the total score for the proposals. The proposals will also be evaluated by the SXSW EDU Advisory Board (40%) and SXSW EDU staff (30%) during this time.

The community will have the opportunity to "Vote Up" or "Vote Down" on all session ideas (votes will be kept private) and add comments to each page.

post_text:
Has anyone done coaching?
 I have a client that reached out to me; I  could facilitate from a coaching aspect; but afraid to cross boundaries...but I  see coaches recommend things that a professional has done and recommended. This line is very blurry to me. Can y'all help me clarify, What the difference is between a coach and a therapist...(I know in my practice but what the view from the outside world and if you do both how do you differentiate.??? Thanks!

comments.text: Really look at the difference between therapeutic exercise and general exercise‚Ä¶. There is very little to no difference. It‚Äôs all on a spectrum. I think it‚Äôs a shame that therapists get overshadowed by trainers but it‚Äôs because we as a profession lack confidence. You can and should coach. But also know school probably didn‚Äôt prepare you for program design. Joe Camoratto covers that pretty well too.

If a strength coach or personal trainer could make the program you‚Äôre making, it‚Äôs not skilled. I‚Äôve coached close to 100 athletes remotely and have no formal personal training or strength coaching education outside of self education

full_thread_text:
POST: Has anyone done coaching?
 I have a client that reached out to me; I  could facilitate from a coaching aspect; but afraid to cross boundaries...but I  see coaches recommend things that a professional has done and recommended. This line is very blurry to me. Can y'all help me clarify, What the difference is between a coach and a therapist...(I know in my practice but what the view from the outside world and if you do both how do you differentiate.??? Thanks!

COMMENT 1: Really look at the difference between therapeutic exercise and general exercise‚Ä¶. There is very little to no difference. It‚Äôs all on a spectrum. I think it‚Äôs a shame that therapists get overshadowed by trainers but it‚Äôs because we as a profession lack confidence. You can and should coach. But also know school probably didn‚Äôt prepare you for program design. Joe Camoratto covers that pretty well too.

COMMENT 2: If a strength coach or personal trainer could make the program you‚Äôre making, it‚Äôs not skilled. I‚Äôve coached close to 100 athletes remotely and have no formal personal training or strength coaching education outside of self education

post_text: I am a mobile LLC PT business and I‚Äôm the only provider.  For becoming in network with Tricare, which application do I do?

comments.text:
They do not accept the group one for physical therapists if it is still on paper. I did that one and got a call 3 months later that it‚Äôs not acceptable and had to fill out the individual one. 

I asked why it was still up if they don‚Äôt take it and why they TOLD me to fill it out and‚Ä¶ just a big shrug of the shoulders from them.
I would do the group so as you grow its covered. They likely also want you to do the individual.

full_thread_text:
POST: I am a mobile LLC PT business and I‚Äôm the only provider.  For becoming in network with Tricare, which application do I do?

COMMENT 1: They do not accept the group one for physical therapists if it is still on paper. I did that one and got a call 3 months later that it‚Äôs not acceptable and had to fill out the individual one. 

I asked why it was still up if they don‚Äôt take it and why they TOLD me to fill it out and‚Ä¶ just a big shrug of the shoulders from them.

COMMENT 2: I would do the group so as you grow its covered. They likely also want you to do the individual.

Hey ya‚Äôll! I‚Äôm meeting with a gym owner next week to brainstorm some ways we can partner together. We both have new businesses and an interest in working with moms and actually met through the local stroller champions group (that she started). Neither of us are fully committed to that niche though and do enjoy working with everyone to promote overall health and wellness. I have some pelvic health experience (looking to grow in this area as well), but not specifically certified at this point. If you work with a local gym OR moms specifically, what are some things that you‚Äôve found to helpful in your community and to grow your business?

ETA: Specifically looking for workshop/seminar/event type ideas that you‚Äôve had personal experience with.

comments.text: I‚Äôve done some events for moms! I try to make it super relaxed (moms and mimosas) to help foster an inviting environment where moms can talk, collaborate and not feel so alone in their physical and mental struggles of motherhood.
The remote strength world is a great spot for busy moms to get back into strength training with whatever they have available at home

post_text: I have a mobile cash-pay practice in Indiana. I want to offer some group sessions/workshops in a local public park.  Do I need to get a special permit from my state or county in order to do this? Should I contant the parks department to get it approved? Do I need to take any special conderations with insurance? I just want to make sure I'm being fully compliant and cover all my bases.

comments.text: Where are you in Indiana?

1. Check that your insurance covers you wherever you are
2. Just to be on the safe side, get the ok from the city Parks & Rec department.  If you are holding formal group events, it‚Äôs safest to let them know

Passing along the Family Smarts was Lisa Nielsen White.  Her daughter was inducted into the National Honor Society!! üéì

Speaking of family KICKING IT UP, I love what Howie Barrett's daughters did in their track meet.  Nat took 2nd ü•à in her 100m race, while Jazzer brought home the gold ü•á in the 200m!!! ü•≥

Alyssa Berman, I'm not even going to attempt to bowl against your son!  Justin got MOST IMPROVED PLAYER in his 1st year of high school bowling!! BAMTASTIC!! ü§©

Speaking of gymnastics, Chris Erickson's daughter smashed it at her recent gymnastics competition this past weekend! WAY TO GO! üí™

PATHWAY member Kelly Hogan announced that the first edition of CHAMP NEWS newsletter will be coming out this week!! Amazing way to serve your clients!! ü§©

Michael Hildebrand, you DEFINITELY Kicked It Up!! Congrats to you and the Mrs on the arrival of master Thomas Michael!! üòç

Meagan Martin-Peiser also did some KICKING this week.  Rather, little Dean Alan did some kicking right on into this world!! CONGRATS on his birth!! üéâ

Something must have been in the water....

Also adding to the family crew was Nicole Edmonds!! She brought (yet to be named) Little Baby Girl Edmonds into the world!! üòç

Announcing that a new addition will be arriving in July was Amy Wolf!!! CONGRATS!! üòç

Changes can be hard.  But, Juliana Bruner Gattle, I am super pumped for you and Josiah to move into your first "grown up" home!!! CONGRATS!! üéâ

There ain't NO stopping Irina Stiasny.  This RUN ROCKET is going to be crushing her 20th 26.2 this weekend!! LET'S GOOO! üëä

To speak to State's Legislative group, you've gotta have at least a little bit of Famousity.  Well, F Scott Feil has more than a little.  CONGRATS on presenting to the Texas Phys. Therapy Assoc Legislative crew!! ... But that's not all that this former Wake Forest Demon Deacon did this past week.  He was the lead on a research presentation at CSM on the topic: "Intrapreneurship: Improving Employee Satisfaction and Retention Through an Innovative Model" ..... I told you this cat had some Famousity. ü§©

Zuzana Rogers played a big part in helping her Nordic skier @jessiediggins to become WORLD CHAMPION at the FIS Nordic World Ski Championships!!! ü•á

Taking her workouts next level was Keri Markut.  She just competed in her first powerlift meet!! SOLID üí™

You know who is going to be KICKING IT UP this weekend - literally??!! Santi Villamil!  He will be participating in a local Dancing With the Stars competition! VAMOS, HERMANO! üï∫

***WHEW!!!!!  Talk about KICKING IT UP A NOTCH!! ***

I have*** ***no doubt that much fantawesomeness was missed.

Still, you ALLLL are incredible!!

Make it a most *BAMFUEGO* weekend!!

We have an audience that other businesses want access to and instead of us just using this audience to get sponsorship and affiliate deals for ourselves, we want to help share those benefits to our community.

post_text:
MAJOR ANNOUNCEMENT. 

TLDR: register for the Uncaged Clinician Community and App launch party using the link in the comments! 

Honestly this is the biggest thing we've ever done at Uncaged Clinician and our team is so excited to start sharing it with you! 

We're in a unique position that we've been asked to leverage for the betterment of PTs, OTs, SLPs, Chiros, Mental Health Providers and more. At first, Josh Payne, David Bayliff and myself wanted to "stay in our lane" and focus on coaching and mentorship but this changes NOW. 

This group has evolved and grown through the last several years and although the growth is exciting, it's also very sad that the level of satisfaction and fulfillment in healthcare seems to be plummeting. 

We all have our thoughts on why this is the case but we're all fighting in isolation and lack a common voice and space for grassroots change and growth. 

Will we "fix" healthcare in the US? probably not, but the goal that we have is to unify the voices of PTs, OTs, SLPs, and more and stop the infighting that keeps us from collective growth. 

In order to bring us more together, we're launching a community platform and app that focuses on clinical and business development, resourcing clinicians, mentorship, collaboration, accountability, and community and we want YOU to be a part of it. 

Yes this will take time and yes there will be some kinks that need to be ironed out but we need a group of clinicians who are willing to be trailblazers with us to help move this mission forward. 

All that being said, we are hosting an EXCLUSIVE training and launch party on March 22nd at 8:00 pm eastern to teach you, motivate you, and show you what we've been working on. 

Spaces in the training are limited and spaces for the trailblazers on the app are going to be limited as we continue to grow and launch this to more and more people! 

Register using the link below and give this post some love because we want to make sure everyone in this group knows that we're on a mission to unify voices in our fields and reinvigorate the passion that you once had for loving, serving, caring, and leading others in healthcare.

post_text:
Do you identify as a Neuro PT and practice in the U.S.? If so, please consider completing this survey on Neuro PT leadership practices:

[https://samuelmerritt.az1.qualtrics.com/.../SV...](https://samuelmerritt.az1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_djtgBvo56bSr0Bo?fbclid=IwAR2R7LGL9b8o9EUKBQXgDpWgEKrcrVqk3MZTD6krAD-ZCn3ayT-eiqx4_aA)

Additionally, if you practice in a clinic that includes or exclusively provides health promotion & wellness/fitness programing for people with neurologic diagnoses, this research also seeks to describe these program characteristics so that we can collaborate in bridging the gap between rehab and wellness/fitness for people with neurologic disability. If we don't know what's out there, we can't connect and work together to meet the needs of our patients. Thank you so much, and please share with a friend! Want to know more, catch me on the "I love neuro" podcast next week, or message me to connect at CSM! (photo cred: [nchpad.org](http://nchpad.org/?fbclid=IwAR31U_WTV0UF2cdfTmlVTMJAri_Ciwv2shwlDz6u-vvDFp9wPaT0OnUlgFc))

post_text:
This year has been very challenging for me‚Ä¶ 

Overwhelm‚Ä¶.
Underwhelm‚Ä¶
Frustration‚Ä¶
Boredom‚Ä¶.
Overwork‚Ä¶.
Underwork‚Ä¶
Underpay‚Ä¶.

All these emotions/ situations wrapped up in a single day, week, month and starting the year.  Getting away from my roots and proven known business concepts has left me paralyzed.  Speaking with my accountability partner these last few days has left me with the realization that I fill my days with tasks that don‚Äôt serve me, my family, my finances or my business. (Yes in that order). I feel busy, but what I am doing is holding space for tasks that won‚Äôt move me forward and missing opportunities that could‚Ä¶ self sabotage is real and this is my limiting belief‚Ä¶ ‚Äúbeing busy will get me to my goals‚Äù. I‚Äôve been lying to myself for the past 30-40 years and have limited myself dramatically.  This year will be different.  

I refuse to allow myself to be held back and kill my dreams‚Ä¶ I am working through my limiting beliefs and making changes to fix myself.  Saying no to things is the first thing I am changing. Let this year be YOUR year to make amazing changes so that all your dreams can come true and you can change your life.

I‚Äôm here rooting for you and if you need an üëÇ 
üòò‚ù§Ô∏èüòò‚ù§Ô∏è
Remember: the fear is feeding you false information, telling you all sorts of bullshit about yourself‚Ä¶ stop listening‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs not helping you at all!!!   
‚ÄúAnd ‚Ä¶.we‚Äôre walkin‚Äô‚Ä¶‚Äù Denver Live event ü§£üòò

Big goals require big help and big faith. Keep reaching out, keep plugging in to community, and keep God at the front of it all.

God is not surprised by anything you do, or anything the world throws at you.

post_text: Any PTs here do coaching for runners? I have a cash based mobile PT side gig and have been able to get well entrenched in our running community and started coaching some athletes on a month by month subscription basis and wondering if anybody else more experience in this area. Looking for any information/strategies people have taken in this area combining PT/coaching.  Thank you üôè

comments.text: Initially I also focus on injury prevention just as Denise Fontana Smith described.  Also,  patient‚Äôs will transition to my coaching program & technique training during the latter phases of rehab (if their goal is to return to running).  I spend 1-2 days/week coaching and programming for folks who are preparing for a race or in the military. Another strategy is to do some small group sessions for runners who have similar goals or experience level. I don‚Äôt do that anymore, but it seemed to work well.  Let me know if you have any specific questions.

We do along with running technique training.  The coaching field is crowded so we focus more on injuries (treatment and prevention) and design programs around that. Smith Physical Therapy and Running Academy

Hello, 
 Is there anybody with a mobile business that has contracted or partnered with an assistive living facility of some kind where you provide group exercise classes for the facility? I'm looking into trying something like this and want some insight from people who have experience. TIA

comments.text: I have some experience with this. It was a great set up, but ultimately the ALF  eventually hired an employee to lead classes as a way to save money. Happy to answer any questions if you‚Äôd like to DM me.

I am contracted with a group of homes with adults with developmental Ôøº disabilities   Homes are group based on gender and level of disability. I have seen it all from humerus fracture from Ôøº a fall during the Highland Park, Fourth of July shootings when the house went on lockdown too simple things like general hypotonia and difficulty ambulating or stair negotiation. The medical Director of these homes is very thankful. She does not have to fill out all of the paperwork for the residence being homebound and likes that I can provide more frequent treatment.

post_text:
I needed to hear this because I have had these thoughts recently. Hope this helps some of you in the trenches with me. 

We all have bad days, weeks or months‚Ä¶. It is the nature of the beast of being a solopreneur and biz owner. Hell it‚Äôs the nature of life. But when is it good to give up??

I heard this from Jake Thompson today on one of his old podcasts.  ‚ÄúNever give up on a bad day. It‚Äôs easy to want to quit on our dreams and desires when we have a bad day, because everything in our perspective makes it seem like we should. But if you have a good day and you still want to quit, then maybe strongly consider it.‚Äù  If you can have a good day and you still don‚Äôt feel like this is for you, don‚Äôt feel bad. Realize that you have the gumption to look at yourself in the face and know that this road isn‚Äôt for you. And that‚Äôs ok. But don‚Äôt give up just because you had a rough/bad day. They are going to happen‚Ä¶

Uncaged clinicians, don‚Äôt give up on your dream because of a rough patch. We all have them, reach out and talk to someone: a mentor, accountability partner, a friend. They can help you through. If after a good day, you still want to quit, then realize this may not be for you, then find a new dream.  And crush that!!  Pivoting is never a bad thing!

comments.text: Always good to hear this. Definitely in the crossroads of decisions
Love it. Thank you for sharing.

post_text: Anyone here got some experience with the Uncaged Clinician Pathway program?

comments.text: I am a fairly new member and am glad I signed up.  I have had a lot of things going on and haven't been able to really dive full speed into the program but will have the chance to do so this month, and I am super excited.  My goal is to open for business in January, and I would like to not have to learn everything the hard way.  I know how to be a PT, but I don't know how to start and run a business - that's why I signed up for the coaching program.  So far, the one-on-one coaching calls have been fantastic.  I've also learned and gotten some ideas from the bi-monthly group calls even though we are not all at the same point in our businesses.

I went through the program in the summer of 2020. I highly recommend the coaching program, worth the investment and helps you get organized as you start your business especially with building relationships and your messaging. The coaches really want the best for you and push you to unlock your potential.

HAPPY PT MONTH!! COLORADO PT/PTAs FYI: Every third Thursday of the month, at 6:15pm, PTs and PTAs throughout Colorado meet via Zoom for an hour informational/educational program.  Topics vary month to month, but I believe you would find them all of interest and benefit to you.  You DO NOT have to be a member of the APTA and/or CO APTA to participate.  The goal is to connect and engage with each other to learn and build a support network for the work we do.  Your attendance would be most welcomed!

ùôÅùôäùôêùôç ùôéùôãùôäùôèùôé ùôçùôÄùôàùòºùôÑùôâ ùôõùô§ùôß ùô©ùôùùôö ùôêùôâùòæùòºùôÇùôÄùòøùôáùôÑùôëùôÄ / ùôáùôñùôóùô§ùôß ùòøùôñùôÆ ùôéùô•ùôöùôòùôûùôñùô°!

We have dedicated this month of September, as an Uncaged team, to helping TEN more brand new practice owners to become fully UNCAGED from your job by being successful with your own practice.

So, what does that look like for this month?

We are giving you a substantial discount ($2500) off of our 1:1 mentorship to give you those results. 

We are dedicated as a team to creating as many Uncaged Clinicians as we possibly can. 

We can‚Äôt work with everyone in this group, so if you are a brand new practice owner and:

üëâüèª You are coachable.
üëâüèª You are motivated and driven for your practice to succeed and for you to become Uncaged
üëâüèª You are kind and fun to work with üòÉ 
üëâüèª You are focused on making a difference in your community and your patients lives

Then, we want to work with you. We believe that we can create change in communities one successful business at a time. 

Comment ‚ÄúUNCAGED‚Äù and I will shoot you over all of the details to be a candidate.

post_text:
ISOLATION: The second great killer of your business 

You weren't meant to do THIS alone and by "THIS" I don't just mean business. 

Scenario 1: I hate when people outside a select few friends ask me how business is going. It doesn't seem fair to have to communicate something as complicated as an entrepreneur's emotions. It's great, it's terrible, it's ok, it's frustrating, it's exhilarating, it's everything at the same time. So most of the time people ask I simply say "it's going well" and leave it at that. 

The problem with this? It puts you on an island feeling that no one can possibly understand or know what you're going through. 

Scenario 2: there's something that's been engrained in you from your childhood- using other people to help you is cheating, you need to do it on your own, group projects are awful, and if you collaborate with someone it cheapens what you're accomplishing. 

All of these things have gone through my head from time to time. I want to prove to everyone that I can do it on my own and don't need to rely on support or help from outsiders. "I didn't borrow money from a wealthy family member to get started." "I'm the reason people are coming to my practice." "I'm going to see how far I can get it on my own before asking for help." 

Phrases like this are so prevalent in our culture. 

Both of these scenarios create a pattern of isolation that make us susceptible to a number of problems. We burn out because we can't sustain the level of energy we're putting in. We quit because there's no accountability to push through challenges. We feel depressed because we're alone. 

At the very least you don't need to do this alone but the honest truth is that doing this alone is irresponsible. Don't let yourself become susceptible to isolation. Surround yourself with community to support you and allow you to have the greatest opportunity to have true success.

comments.text: Good timing. Rough day!

Perfect timing for this!  Ty!

It's great, it's terrible, it's ok, it's frustrating, it's exhilarating, it's everything at the same time. So most of the time people ask I simply say "it's going well" and leave it at that. 

The problem with this? It puts you on an island feeling that no one can possibly understand or know what you're going through. 

Scenario 2: there's something that's been engrained in you from your childhood- using other people to help you is cheating, you need to do it on your own, group projects are awful, and if you collaborate with someone it cheapens what you're accomplishing. 

All of these things have gone through my head from time to time. I want to prove to everyone that I can do it on my own and don't need to rely on support or help from outsiders. "I didn't borrow money from a wealthy family member to get started." "I'm the reason people are coming to my practice." "I'm going to see how far I can get it on my own before asking for help." 

Phrases like this are so prevalent in our culture. 

Both of these scenarios create a pattern of isolation that make us susceptible to a number of problems. We burn out because we can't sustain the level of energy we're putting in. We quit because there's no accountability to push through challenges. We feel depressed because we're alone. 

At the very least you don't need to do this alone but the honest truth is that doing this alone is irresponsible. Don't let yourself become susceptible to isolation. Surround yourself with community to support you and allow you to have the greatest opportunity to have true success.

COMMENT 1: Good timing. Rough day!

COMMENT 2: Perfect timing for this!  Ty! 
I‚Äôm a bit tired of the island lately ‚ù§Ô∏è

post_text:
For those of you who don't know me, yet - I am Kalyca! I work closely with Josh Payne, David Bayliff, and Kevin DeGroot at Uncaged Clinician. 

Over the past two weeks I've had the incredible honor of sitting in on our bi-annual Board Meeting Calls. These are something we do twice a year with each one of our Mastermind Students. 
The goal of these calls is to check-in, vision-cast, and better understand how we can truly show-up and support each individual business owner. 

I recognized something REALLY awesome yesterday that I wanted to share with the whole group...

If you know Josh, David, and Kevin ... you probably already admire them for their modesty and humility. All three of them often say the phrase, "it's not about me"... in reference to how IT IS all about each of our coaching students and IT IS about how we can serve them and care for them to the best of our ability.

Since they would never say this about themselves... I'll open up my loud mouth and share what I've witnessed. Watching them show up over and over and over again for every single one of our students is nothing short of REMARKABLE. 

They are so uniquely talented in recognizing what each person needs, articulating it in a supportive way, and truly serving from their heart so that each person can leave the call with their cup filled in just the right way. The manner through which they intuit this is actually pretty mind blowing to witness...

Support can come in many forms ... sometimes a gentle push, a shoulder to literally cry on, or an accountability partner. These guys always seem to know exactly what each person needs. 
Witnessing this gift in each of them makes me feel energized by how much they are living into their purpose. 

If ever you find yourself wishing you had this level of support... you should certainly consider seeking mentorship from these three... in my completely unbiased opinion üôÉüòèü§£!

post_text:
Hi all... Talk to me about having your own office space.

I currently do social and Sensory groups for kids and I "rent out" rooms at various kid locations (about $50 for each hour of use and I do about 5-6 groups a week as of right now) 

I personally feel like this way works because I am not "tied" down to an actual monthly rent and maintenence fees. But then on the flip side, I feel like I have to ask permission for use and I'm thinking "rent" for my own space may even be less if I continue to do multiple groups a day. I see some similar businesses like mine with their own office and I wonder how they are even doing it (cost wise).

comments.text: I see kids and lease a space. I found a space that is not storefront and not ‚Äúmedical‚Äù. That helps when looking for something affordable. But I also share this space with an OT (I‚Äôm PT). So we share costs but are separate businesses.

Following.

I plan to do group meet ups once I settle in as a mobile peds PT. My initial plan is to rent spaces for the meet ups and once I have enough clients I‚Äôll rent a space, essentially for a clinic and the social groups.

post_text:
Group Coaching is akin to you as a physical therapist taking all of your current back pain patients in a clinic, and telling them:

‚ÄúMoving forward, all of you will be treated in a group and we will be doing the same exercises to cure your back pain.‚Äù

If we were told to treat that way in a clinic we would argue with our superiors that our clients wouldn‚Äôt get 100% better in a group scenario, but yet, we accept it for ourselves as business owners. 

I would say that 95% of business owners aren‚Äôt experiencing the growth that they want in their business because of personal factors rather than having the right tactic for marketing. 

Those personal factors such as imposter syndrome, self-esteem, fear, a spouse not supporting the business, anxiety, ego, etc etc are the major road blocks to substantial and SUSTAINABLE success in business.

You need a personal mentor to coach you through that. 

Just like you would be appalled to treat back pain patients in a group setting in the above scenario‚Ä¶

I am also appalled at the amount of people who simply accept this as ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù as they strive to become the best business owner they can be. 

I don‚Äôt want 80% better for you. I want you to become the best business owner that you can be so that you can radically transform your life AND the lives of your clients. 

This takes personal one-on-one attention and deep work.

post_text: Hi out there! I've been absent from this group but ready to come back. I moved from CA to PA in Sept and upended my life in so many ways. I decided to open my own mobile PT practice and also focus on writing and art. Well, after what I felt was a lot of outreach and networking and advertising locally I've only gotten one patient. Now I see her 2-3 x most weeks so she's a great patient to have! I think the universe knew I wanted to focus on my writing and I really haven't put any energy into the business but am ready to try again. I am a little discouraged however. I put a lot of time into an online free balance class I thought would be a good entry into my business with no success. I became a Medicare Part B provider even though I don't want to deal with insurance, would really like to be cash based, because I'm trying to focus on fall prevention and promoting independence in the elderly and figured I should do it. Any words of wisdom or suggestions out there? I'm not all that comfortable in front of groups so hesitate to do a class or presentation in front of a large group...plus fall prevention in a group...can't really have them do too much without huge liability issues...though I am prepared to do something if I need to. Guess I'm just looking for any words of wisdom, advice, or encouragement any of you who have read this far can offer. Thanks!

comments.text: Let's schedule a chat...
where in PA?

post_text:
We just got back from rafting the Grand Canyon and I had one of the most resonating experiences I've had in a very long time. Spilling my guts here but I think this group will appreciate the sentiment as well as anyone. 

When I was in college, I had the amazing fortune of working as a river guide for 5 years on the Colorado River, mostly in the Grand Canyon. That job prepared me for working as a PT and especially as a small business owner better than almost any other life experience. 

Rafting the Grand Canyon requires traversing a nearly 300 mile long stretch of river that includes some of the biggest whitewater in North America. We use these huge 37 foot, 4 ton, motorized rafts that can carry up to 20 people at a time. 

I applied for my permit to do this in 1997(!), which was the last year I guided and when I was first starting PT school. It's safe to say that I was going into this a bit rusty because there I was, 25 years later, piloting one of those huge motorized rafts, carrying 16 of my family and friends for 10 days, through historically low water.

As intimidated as I was going into this, one of the best things was how awesome it was to  F E E L the Support and Camaraderie from the other boaters down there, both private and commercial. Mistakes are going to happen and we need each other. Everyone has to camp somewhere at night and we have to unofficially coordinate who is staying where. 

The private trips were smaller and scattered around, most of them hadn't really done it before. The big commercial outfitters were pushing through with their huge groups, either in their motor rigs or with groups of up to 6 smaller rafts. But everyone is a part of the community. Everyone has to work together.

That feeling of support and camaraderie I felt in the Grand Canyon is extremely similar to what I feel in this user group. 
It's the feeling I get when I work with other practice owners who are trying to make their way. 
It's the feeling I get when I volunteer with the Private Practice Section of the APTA. 
And it's the feeling I get when I volunteer for our Home Health and Hospice Association or our local Climbing Advocacy Group.

With so many people running through the Grand Canyon at any given time, things could be a lot more competitive. Fortunately, it was absolutely refreshing and impressive to be a part of a community in which the guides and boatmen from each company and private trip work together to look out for each other. This was true for helping each other through the low water runs as well as for coordinating who was camping where each night.

I'd never seen water that low. Somehow, at every turn, another boatman had my back. This stuff is not easy. 
It's very technical. 
Sometimes it's extremely hot. 
Sometimes there are storms that bring thundering flash floods. 
Sometimes other people get stuck on the rocks and we have to help pull them off.

All of that feels extremely similar when I have random employment questions or regulatory or billing questions. The other 'guides' on our trip are incredibly positive as they rally with each other so we all get down safely.

There is an amazing community experience down in the Grand Canyon! There are also amazing communities here in Uncaged, with the Private Practice Section and with the other associations we have out there.  

Thanks to everyone for looking out for each other! What a cool thing to be a part of!

During the past three days I was blessed to host a small group of the UNCAGED CLINICIAN Mastermind students. 

A HUGE THANK YOU to my wife, Cara Bayliff, who took care of outings and meal prepping, and to Hannah Legare (DeGroot) who planned and led the retreat!! üôèüôå

While they were here to learn from Hannah, UNCAGED‚Äôs personal development coach, and me, we were inspired by them. 

That is certainly a trait of a successful practice owner - their ability to inspire others. 

It‚Äôs amazing to know that I have the honor of helping these, and many other business owners like them, to discover and to develop their personal legends.

In doing so, they not only create massive impacts in their communities, but they also generate the abilities to authentically live in their personal ‚ÄúWhy‚Äôs‚Äù. 

As I listened to each one‚Äôs reflection last night, each was ready and eager to move the needle two steps forward.

The cool thing is that it wasn‚Äôt a ‚Äúnew tactic‚Äù that excited them.

Rather, it was their respective personal introspection that showed them their next steps. 

For that, I could not be more excited or proud for each one of them.

post_text:
**Want to know** **when I *REALLY* started loving what I do?**

I have always loved being a therapist.  I seriously don't think that there is anything else that I would do.

Yes, I experienced burnout and all of that other stuff that perhaps many of you have experienced, or are experiencing now.

When I started my own practice in 2013, I finally felt free.

But do you want to know what changed everything for me?

Want to know how I managed to get to where I am today?

Simple, really.

I did two things.

I started investing in myself with coaching.

I started attending LIVE events.  

Not your typical national association conferences.  But true LIVE events- the kind where everyone there was hungry for something different.

Everyone there knew that the status quo just wasn't going to cut it; nor was it going to take them to where they wanted to go.

The energy and momentum that came from those events were immense.

But that's not all that I got from these LIVE events.

Perhaps the greatest gift and value that I received - which skyrocketed me - was the COMMUNITY that was created at each event.

Better yet, it was the FAMILY that bonded us all.

Many stressors that I had suddenly went away, because I had found a family that had my back.  

One with whom we shared ideas - none of which were bad ideas. 

We supported each other.  We encouraged each other.  

Everyone inspired by everyone else.

It was from the same coaching program and LIVE events where I was blessed to have crossed paths with Josh Payne and Kevin DeGroot, both who are now my business partners.

I would venture to say that each of them would credit the investments that they made - and that we have made together - as keys to their successes.

And now, we want nothing more than for YOU to join us in experiencing *community*.

*And to find your family.*

We invite you to commune with us this **Oct 6-9 in Denver, CO**. for the 2nd annual UNCAGEDLIVE22

This event is for PT's, OT's, respective assistants, Chiros, SLP's, LMT's, and more.

To learn more about **UNCAGEDLIVE**, click on the link in the comments below!

We already have more than 100 family members attending!  We want you to come with us!

(Oh, and in case you're wondering.  We have coaching programs for the new and existing practice owners.  We would love to talk to you about them!)

full_thread_text:
POST: **Want to know** **when I *REALLY* started loving what I do?**

I have always loved being a therapist.  I seriously don't think that there is anything else that I would do.

Yes, I experienced burnout and all of that other stuff that perhaps many of you have experienced, or are experiencing now.

When I started my own practice in 2013, I finally felt free.

But do you want to know what changed everything for me?

Want to know how I managed to get to where I am today?

Simple, really.

I did two things.

I started investing in myself with coaching.

I started attending LIVE events.  

Not your typical national association conferences.  But true LIVE events- the kind where everyone there was hungry for something different.

Everyone there knew that the status quo just wasn't going to cut it; nor was it going to take them to where they wanted to go.

The energy and momentum that came from those events were immense.

But that's not all that I got from these LIVE events.

Perhaps the greatest gift and value that I received - which skyrocketed me - was the COMMUNITY that was created at each event.

Better yet, it was the FAMILY that bonded us all.

Many stressors that I had suddenly went away, because I had found a family that had my back.  

One with whom we shared ideas - none of which were bad ideas. 

We supported each other.  We encouraged each other.  

Everyone inspired by everyone else.

It was from the same coaching program and LIVE events where I was blessed to have crossed paths with Josh Payne and Kevin DeGroot, both who are now my business partners.

I would venture to say that each of them would credit the investments that they made - and that we have made together - as keys to their successes.

And now, we want nothing more than for YOU to join us in experiencing *community*.

*And to find your family.*

We invite you to commune with us this **Oct 6-9 in Denver, CO**. for the 2nd annual UNCAGEDLIVE22

This event is for PT's, OT's, respective assistants, Chiros, SLP's, LMT's, and more.

To learn more about **UNCAGEDLIVE**, click on the link in the comments below!

We already have more than 100 family members attending!  We want you to come with us!

(Oh, and in case you're wondering.  We have coaching programs for the new and existing practice owners.  We would love to talk to you about them!)

**AW RITE! AW RITE! AW RITE!**

**It's Friday!!**ü•≥

Time to KICK IT UP A NOTCH!! üï∫

First, WELCOME to all of our NEW MEMBERS!! üëã

Ready to kick it up a notch with the family, Steph Raih just made public that she is expecting kid #4!!!üéâ

Give it up for Kayleigh Coffman.  She just ran the San Diego Rock n Roll Marathon!! NICE HUSTLE!! üí™

You know who KICKED IT UP with her?  David Herzberg! But it's HOW he KICKED IT UP that ***KICKS IT UP! ***He flew to San Diego to totally surprise Kayleigh Coffman AND one of their patients whose goal was to run the race - and ran with them!! THAT is how you LOVE. SERVE. CARE. LEAD!!!‚ù§

While we are on the topic of running, let's talk about Stephanie Mundt.  The woman has had physical setback after physical setback.  We're talking stress fractures, hip labrum stuff, everything.  She just completed her Marathon comeback by running the SD RnR in.... get this... 3:18:34!! BAMFUEGO!! üëä 

Excited for Aimee Sherman!  She just launched her own biz - HUNGRY HEARTS GYM-KITCHEN!!! Fitness and health under one roof!!! LOVE IT!!!‚ù§ü¶Åüëä

Tennis, anyone?  Ginger Morrissey and her partner just won their division at the Member-Guest tournament at Carmel Country Club in Charlotte, NC!! SOLID!! üéâ

Let's all say "Hi" to the new Grandview schools PT, Jo Givhan!!! CONGRATS!!! ü•≥üéâ

UNCAGED PATHWAY member, Brittney Dillman said: "Bye, Felicia" to the JOB and is now FULLY UNCAGED!! SADDLE UP AND LET'S GOOOOO!!! ü¶Åüï∫

This may have been mentioned, by recent PATHWAY member, Tirsa Baker is now FULLY UNCAGED with her cash pediatric practice, RENEW!! That's right. Pediatrics and cash-based.  Tirsa is going to be on the HIGHLIGHT SERIES SHOW with me SOON to share her experiences!  LET'S GOOOOOO!!!! ü¶Å

Chelsea Petrakovitz has expanded her KNAHLEDGE.  She is now a Certified Pregnancy and Postpartum Corrective Exercise Specialist!!!  BOOOOM!! üéâ

You CAN NOT stop J Michelle Martin from dominating.  You can only hope to contain her.  It's possible that she owns the record for KIUAN.  What has she done now?  She is a vital part of the newly launced NBDA WORLDWIDE Doula Clinic!!! I mean, this woman is ON FIRE!!! üî•üî•üî•

Danielle Nonn Farrell kicked life up a notch.  She and NEW hubby, Kyle, got married!!! Let's all head to Rochester for the party!!! üéâ‚ù§

There is someone else kicking the family life up a notch.  Jessica Wright just announced that Baby Fotoorehchi will be making an appearance Nov of this year!!! CONGRATS!!! ü•≥‚ù§

Occasionally you just gotta give a shout out to the spouse of someone in the group.  Let's all rise and put our hands together for Tyson Dukes' wife, Johnna! She was just elected at President of Opticians Association of America!! WOW!!!! CONGRATS!! üî•üëäüéâü•≥

Let's don't forget about Emily Kubat's hustle.  She just completed her first 13.1!! S O L I D!!!üí™üëä

Growing her Famousity is PATHWAY student, Kelsey Harris.  She is being interviewed with JJ Mowder-Tunney!  Who is that you ask?  JJ is pretty much "the Tom Brady" of stroke rehab.  WAY COOL, KELSEY!!! üí™üëä

Excited for Francis Garcia!  He and his wife finally were able to have a house warming party for their newly refurbished home!!üéâ

Speaking of "House Parties", Kevin DeGroot had the Open House for his clinic's (TZeroPhysio) new location this week.  He had 70 people attend !!!!  BAMTASTIC, BRO!!!  Kalyca Jin Zarich, his admin assistant, was part of the festivities!! üéâüéâüéâ

I wanna give it up for Reanna Frigge, PATHWAY student.  She hosted her first workshop this week in which 9 ladies attended.  From that, she had FOUR evals schedule with her!! THAT IS FREAKIN SOLID!!! üëäüî•üï∫ü¶Å

Lara Johnson kicked up her clinic by moving into a bigger, brighter, sunnier spot!! YELLOW BRICK PHYSICAL THERAPY is growing!!!! üéâüëä

You can't get much more famous than appearing on a NATIONAL TV SHOW!!!  That's exactly what Cindy Carron Weinberger will be doing TONIGHT!!! ESPN will be airing a story about her practice, MOBILE THERAPY GROUP, LLC, doing rehab with a collegiate golfer!!  BIG TIME PLAYA!! üï∫üî•üí™

ALL THESE AMAZING WINS, YET I KNOW MANY WERE MISSED!

Go make it a FANTAWESOME weekend, everyone!! üï∫

POST: For those of you who have a brick and mortar, how do you play music? Did you purchase a separate Spotify/Apple/etc account to play all day? I'm currently streaming music off my personal phone but wanted an option for my staff to use when I'm not there üòã

COMMENT 1: One person office here, stream from the Echo (Amazon music) and ask patients what artist/genre they like vs no music or radio or podcast.

COMMENT 2: A separate business Spotify account. It runs through our Roku TV speakers that we useÔøº in our gym.  We did have Alexa last Here, but with Spotify we were able to make a bunch of different playlists based on what the different age groups like who come to us, and then also use it for some of our group classes.

post_text: What are everyone's thoughts on being an APTA member? Worth the cost?

comments.text: I‚Äôm a member.  We have no better option for power on Capitol Hill!  If we lose that, our profession heads in a very bad direction (or continues to).  If we had even half-way decent membership % we could push for some real change and reimbursement.  If not, we can probably just keep watching reimbursements fall ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

We have 100,000 members but there are 500,000 PTs and PTAs in the US. Membership makes the APTA stronger. Without membership we lose our collective voice. We need advocacy for our profession. Become a member, attend local chapter meetings, or join the board of your local chapter. As a member and board member, I recognize many benefits: connections/networking, professional development opportunities, continuing ed, online resources, and reduced rates for conferences to name a few.

full_thread_text:
POST: What are everyone's thoughts on being an APTA member? Worth the cost?

COMMENT 1: I‚Äôm a member.  We have no better option for power on Capitol Hill!  If we lose that, our profession heads in a very bad direction (or continues to).  If we had even half-way decent membership % we could push for some real change and reimbursement.  If not, we can probably just keep watching reimbursements fall ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

COMMENT 2: We have 100,000 members but there are 500,000 PTs and PTAs in the US. Membership makes the APTA stronger. Without membership we lose our collective voice. We need advocacy for our profession. Become a member, attend local chapter meetings, or join the board of your local chapter. As a member and board member, I recognize many benefits: connections/networking, professional development opportunities, continuing ed, online resources, and reduced rates for conferences to name a few.
